text: It was the end of a rather curious speech in which Mr. Macmillan wound up the two-day debate on foreign affairs. He began in a low, almost chatty monotone, and his voice never rose to any accent of urgency. He passed in rapid review the United Nations Secretariat; nuclear tests; the canard about British interference with the United Nations in the Congo; Kuwait; and South-East Asia.
handwritten_text: It was the end of a rather curious speech in which Mr. Macmillan wound up the two-day debate on foreign affairs. He began in a low, almost chatty monotone, and his voice never rose to any accent of urgency. He passed in rapid review the United Nations Secretariat; nuclear tests; the canard about British interference with the United Nations in the Congo; Kuwait; and South-East Asia.
